intro: Nicotiana gossei, commonly known as the Gosselina tobacco, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant is characterized by its striking blue or violet flowers and hairy stems. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
